Tch bit hai chc nng, mt i tng s lu trng thi, i tng ny khng c reload. Mt i tng khc bn gm tt c cc trng thi thai i logic, i tng ny c th c reload n khng h gi trng thi no c.

Vn 2: Trng thi c th b ghi bi mi mt action

In time travel debugging, you keep track of each version of a state object. That way, you can go back to an earlier state.

Each time the state is changed, you need to add the old state to an array of previous state objects. But because of the way JavaScript works, simply adding the variable to the array wont work. This doesnt create a snapshot of the object, it just creates a new pointer to the same object.

To make it work, each version needs to be an entirely separate object so that you arent accidentally changing past versions.

Solution
When an action comes in to the store, dont handle it by changing the state. Instead, copy the state and make changes to the copy.

Problem 3: There arent good places for third-party plugins to jump in

When youre making developer tools, you need to be able to write them generically. A user should be able to just drop the tool in without having to custom fit their own code around it.

For this to work, you need extension points places where the code expects to have things added to it.

An example is logging. Lets say you want to console.log() every action as it comes in, and then console.log() the state that results from it. In Flux, youd have to subscribe to the dispatchers updates and to updates from each store. But thats custom code, not something a third-party module can easily do.

Solution
Make it easy to wrap parts of the system in other objects. These other objects add their bit of functionality on top of the original. You can see these kinds of extension points in things like enhancers or higher order objects, as well as middleware.

In addition, use a tree to structure the state change logic. This makes it so the store only emits one event to notify the views that the state has changed. This event comes after the whole state tree has been processed.


Note: With these problems and solutions, Im focusing on the developer tooling use case. These changes help in other use cases, too. On top of that, there are other differences between Redux and Flux. For example, Redux also reduces boilerplate and it makes it easier to reuse logic in the store. Heres a list of some other upsides to Redux.

So lets see how Redux makes these things possible.

The new cast of characters

The new cast of characters

Action creators

Redux keeps the action creator from Flux. Whenever you want to change the state of the application, you shoot off an action. Thats the only way that the state should be changed.

As I said in the article on Flux, I think of the action creator as a telegraph operator. You go to the action creator knowing basically what message you want to send, and then the action creator formats that in a way that the rest of the system can understand.

**
Unlike Flux, action creators in Redux do not send the action to the dispatcher. Instead, they return a formatted action object.
**

The Store

I described stores in Flux as over-controlling bureaucrats. All state changes must be made personally by a store and have to go through the action pipeline, instead of being requested directly. The store in Redux is still controlling and bureaucratic, but its a little bit different.

In Flux, you can have multiple stores. Each store has its own little fiefdom, and it is in total control. It holds on to its little slice of state, and has all the logic for changing that little slice of state.

The Redux store tends to delegate more. And it has to. In Redux, there is only one store so if it did everything itself, it would be taking on too much work.

Instead, it takes care of holding on to the whole state tree. It then delegates the work of figuring out what state changes need to happen. The reducers, headed up by the root reducer, take on this task.

You might have noticed theres no dispatcher. Thats because, in a bit of a power grab, the store has also taken over dispatching.

The reducers

When the store needs to know how an action changes the state, it asks the reducers. The root reducer takes charge and slices the state up based on the state objects keys. It passes each slice of state to the reducer that knows how to handle it.

I think of the reducers as a department of white-collar workers who are a little overzealous about photocopying. They dont want to mess anything up, so they dont change the state that has been passed in to them. Instead, they make a copy and make all their changes on the copy.

This is one of the key ideas of Redux. The state object isnt manipulated directly. Instead, each slice is copied and then all of the slices are combined into a new state object.

The reducers pass their copies back to the root reducer, which pastes the copies together to form the updated state object. Then the root reducer sends the new state object back to the store, and the store makes it the new official state.

If you have a small application, you might only have one reducer making a copy of the whole state object and making its changes. Or if you have a large application, you might have a whole tree of reducers. This is another difference between Flux and Redux. In Flux, the stores arent necessarily connected to each other and they have a flat structure. In Redux, the reducers are in a heirarchy. This hierarchy can have as many levels as needed, just like the component hierarchy.

The views: smart and dumb components

Flux has controller views and regular views. The controller views act as middle managers, managing the communication between the store and their child views.

In Redux, theres a similar concept: smart and dumb components. The smart components are the managers. They follow a few more rules than the controller views, though:

- Smart components are in charge of the actions. If a dumb component underneath them needs to trigger an action, the smart component passes a function in via the props. The dumb component can then just treat that as a callback.
- Smart components do not have their own CSS styles
- Smart components rarely emit DOM of their own. Instead, they arrange dumb components, which handle laying out DOM elements.

Dumb components dont depend on action files directly, since all actions are passed in via props. This means that the dumb component can be reused in a different app that has different logic. They also contain the styles that they need to look reasonably good (though you can allow for custom stylingjust accept a style prop and merge it in to the default styles).

The view layer binding

To connect the store to the views, Redux needs a little help. It needs something to bind the two together. This is called the view layer binding. If youre using React, this is react-redux.

The view layer binding is kind of like the IT department for the view tree. It makes sure that all of the components can connect to the store. It also takes care of a lot of technical details so that the rest of the hierarchy doesnt have to understand them.

The view layer binding introduces three concepts:
1. The Provider component: This is wrapped around the component tree. It makes it easy for the root components children to hook up to the store using connect().
2. connect(): This is a function provided by react-redux. If a component wants to get state updates, it wraps itself using connect(). Then the connect function will set up all the wiring for it, using the selector.
3. selector: This is a function that you write. It specifies what parts of the state a component needs as properties.

The root component

All React applications have root components. This is just the component at the top level of the component hierarchy. But in Redux applications, this component takes on more responsibility.

The role it plays is kind of like a C-level executive. It puts all of the teams in place to tackle the work. It creates the store, telling it what reducer to use, and brings together the view layer binding and the views.

The root component is pretty hands-off after it initializes the app, though. It doesnt get caught up in the day-to-day concerns of triggering rerenders. It leaves that to the components below it, assisted by the view layer binding.

How they all work together

Lets see how these parts work together to create a functioning app.

The Setup

The different parts of the app need to be wired up together. This happens in setup.

  1. Get the store ready. The root component creates the store, telling it what root reducer to use, using createStore(). This root reducer already has a team of reducers which report to it. It assembled that team of reducers using combineReducers().

  1. Set up the communication between the store and the components.* The root component wraps its subcomponents with the provider component and makes the connection between the store and the provider.

The Provider creates whats basically a network to update the components. The smart components connect to network using connect(). This ensures theyll get state updates.

  1. Prepare the action callbacks. To make it easier for dumb components to work with actions, the smart components can setup action callbacks by using bindActionCreators(). This way, they can just pass down a callback to the dumb component. The action will be automatically dispatched after it is formatted.

The data flow

Now that the application is set up, the user can start interacting with it. Lets trigger an action to see the data flow.

  1. The view requests an action. The action creator formats it and returns it.

  1. The action is either dispatched automatically (if bindActionCreators() was used in setup), or the view dispatches the action.

  1. The store receives the action. It sends the current state tree and the action to the root reducer.

  1. The root reducer cuts apart the state tree into slices. Then it passes each slice to the subreducer that knows how to deal with it.

  1. The subreducer copies the slice and makes changes to the copy. It returns the copy of the slice to the root reducer.

  1. Once all of the subreducers have returned their slice copies, the root reducer pastes all of them together to form the whole updated state tree, which it returns to the store. The store replaces the old state tree with the new one.

  1. The store tells the view layer binding that theres new state.

  1. The view layer binding asks the store to send over the new state.

  1. The view layer binding triggers a rerender.

So thats how I think of Redux and its differences from Flux. Hope it helps!

Kt lun

cm n v bi vit rt th v i ca Lin Clark v code-cartoons.com.

redux l mt kin trc mi cho tng view n c facebook pht trin gii qut cc vn c hu ca facebook khi dng MVC. t xa n nay lm vic vi font-end s c hai dng kin trc chnh:

  1. kin trc hng s kin c ngha l s ln lt ng k cc s kin, khi c s kin th thc thi hot ng ri update view. trang nh th khng sao nu trang ln v logic phc tp th n tr thnh thm ha c vi UX v DX, u tin bn s khng th no phn bit c cc thnh phn cng nh vng i ca cc s kin, ri s ra sao nu mun thm mt tc v cho s kin no . n mt lc bn nhn li ng sn phm ca mnh v ch c mnh c th p i xy li t u.

  2. kin trc MVC y l kin trc kinh in vi cc developer ri nhng vi ch view layer th MVC dng nh khng . vi font-end quan h gia M-C phc tp hn back-end.

Post.title: SEO vs. React: Google thng minh hn bn tng!
Post._content:
{% asset_img cover.png "React vs SEO" %}

Ngy nay cc ng dng web ang dn thay th dn cc website truyn thng vi mt lot cc cng ngh hin i  xy dng ng dng web t ajax-based, Backbone, Angular, Ember,  React ri Web-components... Nhng mt trong nhng im Nhiu nghi vn lo ngi chnh l nhng ng dng web khng thn thin vi SEO, liu iu  thc h ra sao???

<!--more-->

QUan nim trong ngh: cc crawlers ca cc my tm kim s khng th thu thp y  ni dung ca trang hin th trn trnh duyt, n ch c th hin th ni dung HTML trong ln y duyt trang nhng ni dung ng c dng bng javascript sau  s b b qua.

S ra sao nu HTML ch cha vi ba meta tag v script tag, my tm kim s nhn tht trang ca bn hu nh trng rng v xp hng tp cho tranng web ca bn.


Ti thng thy nhng hng dn v SEO thng khuyn co tt c ni dung ca bn phi c dng t pha server  my tm kim d dng thy c ni dng ca trang v xp hng cao hn.

vi ti, li khun ny c v khng thc t, y l nm 2016, ngi dng mong ch mi trng web ng v mt tri nghim mt m hn, v h khng mun phi chuyn trng co mi c click chut.

Vy quan nim "client-side rendering khng thn thin vi SEO" liu c cn chnh xc?

## Cng Tm Hiu
![](1.gif)

Ti khng phi l mt chuyn gia SEO, nhng ti qut nh tm hiu mi cht v lnh cc ny v y l nhng g ti tm thy.

y l mt bn [thng bo](https://webmasters.googleblog.com/2015/10/deprecating-our-ajax-crawling-scheme.html) t Google trn trang blog webmaster ca h tu thng 10/2015:

{% blockquote %}
Today, as long as youre not blocking Googlebot from crawling your JavaScript or CSS files, we are generally able to render and understand your web pages like modern browsers. To reflect this improvement, we recently updated our technical Webmaster Guidelines to recommend against disallowing Googlebot from crawling your sites CSS or JS files.

i  l chng ti hon ton c th dng v hiu trng web cu bn nh nhng trnh duyt hi i, bao gm vic thc thi javascript v dng li nhng ni dng ng ca trang.
{% endblockquote %}

Cn y la mt [bi vit](http://searchengineland.com/tested-googlebot-crawls-javascript-heres-learned-220157) t Search Engine Land t thng 5/2015.

{% blockquote %}
We ran a series of tests that verified Google is able to execute and index JavaScript with a multitude of implementations. We also confirmed Google is able to render the entire page and read the DOM, thereby indexing dynamically generated content.

SEO signals in the DOM (page titles, meta descriptions, canonical tags, meta robots tags, etc.) are respected. Content dynamically inserted in the DOM is also crawlable and indexable. Furthermore, in certain cases, the DOM signals may even take precedence over contradictory statements in HTML source code. This will need more work, but was the case for several of our tests.

i : chng ti  thc hin mi s th nghm v xc nhn rng Google c th thc thi javascript. Ni dng ng c t ng thm vo DOM cng c crawler thu nh y  , trong nhieeuf trng hp, mc d tnh nng ny vn cha hon thi nhng  cng  vt qua c rt nhiu test case khc nhau.
{% endblockquote %}

## Preactjs.com Test

Gn y ti c mt tweet than th v SEO, ti ang trong qu trnh chuyn sang [Preact](http://www.preactjs.com/), mi thu vin nh thay th cho React ca Facebook. ti  nhn c mt tr li t [ Jason Miller](https://twitter.com/_developit) mi trong nhng dev pht trin Preact:

![](2.5.png)

Bn cnh nghi cu ca Search Engine Land tooi va mi trch dn bn trn Jason  c dn mi link tm kim ca Google cho trang ch ca Preact.

![](2.png)

y l mt trng client-side rendering tuuwcs h hu ht ni dng  owcj javascript thm vo t pha trnh duyt web, code HTML t sever s trng nh sau:

```html
<!DOCTYPE html><html><head>
<meta charset="utf-8">
<title>Preact: Fast 3kb React alternative with the same ES6 API. Components & Virtual DOM.</title>
<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width,initial-scale=1,maximum-scale=1,minimal-ui">
<meta name="mobile-web-app-capable" content="yes">
<meta name="apple-mobile-web-app-capable" content="yes">
<meta name="format-detection" content="telephone=no">
<meta name="theme-color" content="#673AB8">
<link rel="manifest" href="/manifest.json">
<link rel="icon" type="image/png" href="/assets/app-icon-192.png" sizes="192x192">
<script>(function(url){window['_boostrap_'+url]=fetch(url);})('/content'+location.pathname.replace(/^\/(repl)?\/?$/, '/index')+'.md');</script>
<link rel="shortcut icon" href="/favicon.ico">
<link href="/style.6bae35e4ff9d687cb418.css" rel="stylesheet">
</head><body>
<script>(function(i,s,o,g,r,a,m){i['GoogleAnalyticsObject']=r;i[r]=i[r]||function(){(i[r].q=i[r].q||[]).push(arguments)},i[r].l=1*new Date();a=s.createElement(o),m=s.getElementsByTagName(o)[0];a.async=1;a.src=g;m.parentNode.insertBefore(a,m)})(window,document,'script','//www.google-analytics.com/analytics.js','ga');ga('create', 'UA-6031694-20', 'auto');ga('send', 'pageview');</script>
<script type="text/javascript" src="/bundle.a0afd09fd48712ed0f26.js"></script>
</body></html>
```

Nu nh Googlebot khng th c c HTL sinh t Preact kt qu tm kim s hu nh khng c g ngoi vi meta tags.

In my research I couldnt find any evidence that Yahoo, Bing, or Baidu support JavaScript in their crawlers. If SEO on these search engines is important to you, youll need to use server-side rendering, which Ill discuss in a future article.
{% endblockquote %}

{% asset_img cover.png "React vs SEO" %}

Ngy nay cc ng dng web ang dn thay th dn cc website truyn thng vi mt lot cc cng ngh hin i  xy dng ng dng web t ajax-based, Backbone, Angular, Ember,  React ri Web-components... Nhng mt trong nhng im Nhiu nghi vn lo ngi chnh l nhng ng dng web khng thn thin vi SEO, liu iu  thc h ra sao???

<!--more-->

QUan nim trong ngh: cc crawlers ca cc my tm kim s khng th thu thp y  ni dung ca trang hin th trn trnh duyt, n ch c th hin th ni dung HTML trong ln y duyt trang nhng ni dung ng c dng bng javascript sau  s b b qua.

S ra sao nu HTML ch cha vi ba meta tag v script tag, my tm kim s nhn tht trang ca bn hu nh trng rng v xp hng tp cho tranng web ca bn.


Ti thng thy nhng hng dn v SEO thng khuyn co tt c ni dung ca bn phi c dng t pha server  my tm kim d dng thy c ni dng ca trang v xp hng cao hn.

vi ti, li khun ny c v khng thc t, y l nm 2016, ngi dng mong ch mi trng web ng v mt tri nghim mt m hn, v h khng mun phi chuyn trng co mi c click chut.

Vy quan nim "client-side rendering khng thn thin vi SEO" liu c cn chnh xc?

## Cng Tm Hiu
![](1.gif)

Ti khng phi l mt chuyn gia SEO, nhng ti qut nh tm hiu mi cht v lnh cc ny v y l nhng g ti tm thy.

y l mt bn [thng bo](https://webmasters.googleblog.com/2015/10/deprecating-our-ajax-crawling-scheme.html) t Google trn trang blog webmaster ca h tu thng 10/2015:

{% blockquote %}
Today, as long as youre not blocking Googlebot from crawling your JavaScript or CSS files, we are generally able to render and understand your web pages like modern browsers. To reflect this improvement, we recently updated our technical Webmaster Guidelines to recommend against disallowing Googlebot from crawling your sites CSS or JS files.

i  l chng ti hon ton c th dng v hiu trng web cu bn nh nhng trnh duyt hi i, bao gm vic thc thi javascript v dng li nhng ni dng ng ca trang.
{% endblockquote %}

Cn y la mt [bi vit](http://searchengineland.com/tested-googlebot-crawls-javascript-heres-learned-220157) t Search Engine Land t thng 5/2015.

{% blockquote %}
We ran a series of tests that verified Google is able to execute and index JavaScript with a multitude of implementations. We also confirmed Google is able to render the entire page and read the DOM, thereby indexing dynamically generated content.

SEO signals in the DOM (page titles, meta descriptions, canonical tags, meta robots tags, etc.) are respected. Content dynamically inserted in the DOM is also crawlable and indexable. Furthermore, in certain cases, the DOM signals may even take precedence over contradictory statements in HTML source code. This will need more work, but was the case for several of our tests.

i : chng ti  thc hin mi s th nghm v xc nhn rng Google c th thc thi javascript. Ni dng ng c t ng thm vo DOM cng c crawler thu nh y  , trong nhieeuf trng hp, mc d tnh nng ny vn cha hon thi nhng  cng  vt qua c rt nhiu test case khc nhau.
{% endblockquote %}

![](2.5.png)

Bn cnh nghi cu ca Search Engine Land tooi va mi trch dn bn trn Jason  c dn mi link tm kim ca Google cho trang ch ca Preact.

![](2.png)

y l mt trng client-side rendering tuuwcs h hu ht ni dng  owcj javascript thm vo t pha trnh duyt web, code HTML t sever s trng nh sau:

Post.title: Vit JS theo phong cch hng module - phn 2
Post.content:
Tip ni series v java module ha trong javascript hm nay chng ta s cp n mt cng rt quan trng chnh l bundeling. Vi nodejs hoc mt s framework font-end nh Angular 2, React du recommend vit hng module v chia ra nhiu file khc nhau n khi build cc file s c gp li mt file duy nht v thc thi, cn vi cc ng dng t xy dng th sao?. bi vit ny s cp n vn s dng browersify v babel module ha ng dng ra tng file v build li dc mt ng dng hon chnh, like a boss .

Bundling l g

Chc hn cc bn cng khng xa l g vi thut ng ny na bundling chnh l vic ta chi ng dng ra cc module mt module lu v mt file ring v require tt cc cc module cn thit trong qu trnh build.

Bundling thc s rt c ngha nht l vi cc ng dng c scope ln cng nh team nhiu thnh vin hoc ng dng c yu cu maintain lu di. vic chia ra mi module mt file chc chn s gip cho qu trnh pht trin d dng hn v hn ch c nhiu li do cc thnh vin rng team gy ra.

Mt s cch Bundling

link trc tip

Cch n gian nht chnh l c vit mi module mt file ri link tng file vo trang HTML, cch ny ni chung kh l bt tin mi khi thm mt module ta li phi m trang HTML thm thm sa sa va d nhm va mt thi gian.

Ri n khi thay di tn module hay ng dn th cu chuyn kinh d li tip tc, dev li phi h hc sa sa xa xa .

Cn cha k cch ny thc s khng tt khi xt n hiu nng, s lng module cng ln th s request m trang thc hin cng tng tho dn n tc load trang s tr nn rt s lu.

s dng require.js

Requirejs l mt cng c JavaScript file and module loader chy trn trnh duyt khi s dng ta chi cn mt cht config v ng dn n cc module khi ta require module no n s t ng load module vo trnh duyt. Nghe c c v mi th hon ho ch tr mt hn ch n l hiu nng vn cha tt nu ta chia cc module qu nh.

s dng webpack

V ri Nodejs ra i vi commonjs (mt version ca requirejs chy trn node) v systemjs mt module loader khc h tr ES6, u tin cc cng c module loader ny to ra phc c ng dng Nodejs server side nhng v bn cht ng dng backend hay front end vit bng js l hon taonf ging nhau v hon on c th dng cc module loader ny build ng dng front-end ging nh lm vi back-end vy.

Nh mnh gii thiu mt bi vit trc y webpack l mt cng c build tuyt vi cho front end app hm nay a s s dng webpack kt hp vi mt cng c l babelfy chuyn c php ES6 v ES5.

V d

B qua m l thuyt xung i, hm nay mnh s lm 1 v d ch mang tnh minh ha thi , v ngh mi m khng ra ci g hay ho c .

Mnh s lm 1 ng dng gm hin th ra mn hnh 3 vn th 1 qu bng, mt khi hp v mt ch cn, 3 vt th ny s c gn ngu nhin 3 hnh ng blink (nhp nhy ), bounce (ny) v spin (xoay). c bn l th iu quan trng l mi mt class ta s vit trn 1 file.

Chun b

  • u tin ta phi c nodejs v npm, tt nhin ri
  • Tip theo l ci wpebpack:

-to th mc demo v khi to npm project trong th mc ny.

Ci babel-loader v babel-presents-es2015 dch ES6

OK, Lets go

tip theo to cc file v th mc ca project nh sau:

  • xxx/demo
    • package.json
    • webpack.config.js
    • node_modules (binary root)
    • src
      • app.js
      • behavior
        • action.js
        • blink.js
        • spin.js
      • body
        • body.js
        • circle.js
        • square.js
        • dog.js
    • dest
      • dog.png
      • index.html

Webpack s dng file webpack.config.js cha cc ty chn build, n gin ha ta s rt gn ht mc c th, webpack.config.js s trng nh sau:

File ny ch ddn gin l bo webpack dch file src/app.js ra file
dest/main.js v dng babel chuyn es2015 sang es5 thi.

tip theo ta phi c file index.html trnh duyt cn chy vo, file ny sexchuwas 1 ca khung rng v load file main.js vo.

he, sut na qun cng vic chnh . V phn javajcript file chnh ca ta l app.js file ny s import cc module khc v to thnh ng dng hon chnh.

src/app.js

src/body/body.js

src/circle.js

src/square.js

src/dog/js

src/behavior/action.js

src/behavior/blink.js

src/behavior/spin.js

src/behavior/bounce.js

Phuzzz, di qu!
Cui cng bn chy

V bm!!! bt ng cha? ng dng ca bn c build ra mt file duy nht dest/main.js bn hy m file index.html trnh duyt v tn hng thnh qu thi.

Thnh qu

Sau mt thi gian code mit mi cui cng ta s c thnh qu sau:

bn c th ti m ngun ti y.

Li kt

C l bi ny code hi di nh, ci mnh mun show y l cch chng ta to ra app ch khng phi kt qu, my ci hiu ng nhm shit ny bt c ai phy tay ci cng ra c. bn s thy cch ny tt khi bn bt u xy dng nhng sn phm thc s, ri cn maintain nhiu refactor thng xuyn m nhn s li thay i lin tc.

Cm n cc bn theo di bi vit. xin hn gp li bi vit sau.

Vi nodejs hoc mt s framework font-end nh Angular 2, React du recommend vit hng module v chia ra nhiu file khc nhau n khi build cc file s c gp li mt file duy nht v thc thi, cn vi cc ng dng t xy dng th sao?. bi vit ny s cp n vn s dng browersify v babel module ha ng dng ra tng file v build li dc mt ng dng hon chnh, like a boss .

Post.title: gii thiu Linked Data v Semantic web
Post._content:
![](/image/posts/gioi-thieu-Linked-Data-va-Semantic-web/1.jpeg)
> **Linked Data** (d liu lin kt) v **Semantic web** (web mang  ngha) l ci g? ni mt cch n gin th  Semantic web l mt cng ngh ca [web 3.0](/tags/web-3.0) - mt cch  lin kt d liu gia cc h thng, cc thc th  lm phong ph thm thng tin, t m t tng quan ca d liu c sn trn b cc web trn phm vi ton cu.  

<!--more-->

v bn cht n l mt s thay i trong suy ngh t vic xut bn cc ti liu HTML m con ngi c th c c sang mt loi ti liu m my tnh d dng c c ri sau  th hin cho con ngi.

# Web ngy nay ang i nh th no?

Ngy nay, phn ln d liu chng ta nhn c t web u  di dng cc trang web - nhng trang HTML c lin kt vi nhau qua cc siu lin kt (hypelinks). c con ngi v my tnh u c th c c nhng ti liu ny, nhng khng n gin nh vic tm kim t kha trong trang, my tnh gp rt nhiu kh khn trong vic truy xut  ngha t d liu ca cc ti liu ny.

{% youtube OM6XIICm_qo %}
Tim Berners-Lee: The next web 

# Nhp Linked Data - gii phng c s d liu web t h thng sn c

Th gi web cha mt lng thng tin rt ln, nhng thng thng nhng d liu th khng c sn - ch c cc ti liu HTML c xy dng t d liu - mi trang web u c xy dng t d liu.

do  **Sematic Web** c gng to ra s thay i "cnh quan
 ca Internet i vi vn  ny bng mt s cch sau:
- m ca d liu trn web  cho cc tin trnh tr tu nhn to (Artficial Inteligence) (web c th suy ngh mt cht thay cho con ngi)
- khuyn khch cc cng ty, cc t chc v c nhn xut bn t do d liu ca h theo mt nh dng chun chung.
- khuyn khch cc cng ty s dng d liu  c sn trn web (cho v nhn d liu).

ni mt cch nm na, ta s thu thp ton b d liu  c xut bbanr trn cc ti liu HTML t mi ni trn Internet thm nhng m t v m hnh d liu cho php chng c i x v nghin cu nh trn mt c s d liu duy nht.vic t ng nghin cu ton b d liu ca loi ngi trn Internet chc chn s em li li ch v cng ln.

# nhng ti phi bt u t u?

![](./2.png)

khng qu phc tp u, chng ti  xy dng mt sies cc gii thiu v cc cng ngh lin quan n **Sematic Web** v **Linked Data**.

- **TUT 1** [gii thiu Graph databse](#) - cho bn mt ci nhn tng quan v cch lu tr d liu **semantic web**.
- **TUT 2** [tng quan v RDF](#) - gii thiu Resource Description Framework (RDF), nh dang semantic s dng  lu tr trong graph databases.
- **TUT 3** [Semantic Modeling](#) -gii thiu mt kha cnh rt quan trng din t  ngh ca d liu.
- **TUT 4** [gii thiu RDFS & OWL](#) -c php quan trng semantic web s ng  gii m  ngh sang d liu.
- **TUT 4** [Truy vn Semantic Data](#) -lm sao  truy vn sematic data s dng giao thc SPARQL.

Post.title: Yahoo 360, ci cht ca mt con thin nga
Post._content:
{% asset_img 1.jpg "no caption" %}

rnh lc li ng ghi ch trn facebook thy bi vit t mt nm trc, c li thy hi bun ci :D

<!--more-->
Tht lng m ni mnh vit kh (rt :) ) d nhng mi lc c tm trng l mnh li mun vit ci g ,  lu li,  suy ngh,  gii ta nh mt nhu cu t nhin. vi cc th h 8x, 9x m ni yahoo 360  tng mt a ch quen thuc ging nh facebook by gi  vy. mt mng x hi ca cc bolgger ni ngi ta chia s cm xc, k cho nhau nhng cu chuyn hay, th hin c tnh,  suy ngh ca mnh. mt thi i huy hong ca blog.

Th  ri mng x hi ra i cc bn tr bt u n vi facebook nh mt cch gii tr mi hp dn hn, tin li hn cng ng dn quay lng vi yahoo 306 nh mt a tr b qun mt mn  chi  c.  facebook nh mt x hi thu nh vy c tt c xu thng tin nhiu v s k v lun lun mi m lun lun HOT. mng x hi  nhanh chng tr thnh mt phn ca cuc sng hin i.
Yahoo khai t con thin nga yahoo 360, c dn mng ht hng v  sa cha sai lm ca mnh h to ra mt con vt yahoo 360 plus  th ch v tt nhin nhng fan rut ca yahoo 306 kh c th chp nhn c s th ch ny.

theo mnh th nhu cu vit blog vn rt ln, mt suy ngh trong u cht le ln "li mnh c th to c mt sn chi cho cc blogger hay khng", tht lng m ni hin ti th khng. khng  kh nng, khng  nhit huyt  hin thc gic m ny.  nh ngm ngi note li nhng suy ngh ny huy vng mt ngy p tri khng xa mnh c th tm thy cm hng  hon thin gic m ny. mnh t khi vit, vit cng khng hay m cn thy tic nui cho s ra i ca yahoo 360 na, chc chn ngoi ka cn c rt nhiu ngi c nhu cu c mt blog ca ring mnh. hy vng n mt ngy cc blogger  tr li. mt gc nh su lng ca th gii o, ni ngi ta sng chm li cm nhn nhiu hn, yu thng nhiu hn.

Th  ri mng x hi ra i cc bn tr bt u n vi facebook nh mt cch gii tr mi hp dn hn, tin li hn cng ng dn quay lng vi yahoo 306 nh mt a tr b qun mt mn  chi  c.  facebook nh mt x hi thu nh vy c tt c xu thng tin nhiu v s k v lun lun mi m lun lun HOT. mng x hi  nhanh chng tr thnh mt phn ca cuc sng hin i.

theo mnh th nhu cu vit blog vn rt ln, mt suy ngh trong u cht le ln "li mnh c th to c mt sn chi cho cc blogger hay khng", tht lng m ni hin ti th khng. khng  kh nng, khng  nhit huyt  hin thc gic m ny.  nh ngm ngi note li nhng suy ngh ny huy vng mt ngy p tri khng xa mnh c th tm thy cm hng  hon thin gic m ny. mnh t khi vit, vit cng khng hay m cn thy tic nui cho s ra i ca yahoo 360 na, chc chn ngoi ka cn c rt nhiu ngi c nhu cu c mt blog ca ring mnh. hy vng n mt ngy cc blogger  tr li. mt gc nh su lng ca th gii o, ni ngi ta sng chm li cm nhn nhiu hn, yu thng nhiu hn.

Xin cho anh em, k t thng ny Blog nh mnh s c thm mt chuyn mc mi  l Javascript Monthly (cheers...........), y s l ni tng hp nhng bi vit hay nht trong thng v cng ng javascript trn ton th gii. Hy vng s mang ti c cho anh em nhng bi vit thc s cht.
<!--more-->
# javascript monthly Oct, 2016

Thng va ri chng ta c rt nhiu bi vit hay, mt trong nhng l do mnh kt JS chnh l v cng ng rt nng ng v hot ng cc k si ni  mang n mt cuc cch mng thc s trong web developemnt. im qua cc bi vit hay ca thng ny c th nhc n 2 lung cm xc, vui c, bun c:

Tin vui l cng ng javascript c v nh ngy cng nng ng hn, tht khng iu khi ni rng Javascript l ngn ng lp trnh ph bin nht th gii, t front-end n back-end thp ch l c mobile JS ang nh bc dp ng v phn no thu hp t din ca cc ngn ng khc. Mi ngy cng ng li cho n mt vi frameworks, libs, tools hoc articles mi dev li c thm nhiu la chn hn trong pht trin v trn ht l mang n cho ngi dng tri nghim tt nht vi tng sn phm chng ta to ra.

Cn tin bun l g? ci g cng c mt tri ca n, bi vit #1 ca chng ta cng chnh l ni long ca rt nhiu anh em dev, qu nhiu frameworks, qu nhiu tools khin cho cc dev phi vt ln rt nhiu t vic la chn ri hc cch s dng v hu nh mi d n ta u phi bt u li mi th t du. Vi mnh th y cha hn l xu t nht vi js mi d n u em li cho mnh cm gic mi m khi c hc thm nhiu iu th v mi.

{% blockquote  "How it feels to learn JavaScript in 2016 (Rank 1)" %}
Im just going to move back to the backend. I just cant handle these many changes and versions and editions and compilers and transpilers. The JavaScript community is insane if it thinks anyone can keep up with this...
{% endblockquote %}

## Rank #1
How it feels to learn Javascript in 2016. Courtesy of [Jose Aguinaga](https://medium.com/u/4eb81b32b99a) and [Hackernoon](https://medium.com/u/4a8a924edf41)
[read more](https://hackernoon.com/how-it-feels-to-learn-javascript-in-2016-d3a717dd577f#.tzyr3yakf)
{% asset_img "1.png" "#1" %}

## Rank #2
Step-by-step tutorial to build a modern JavaScript stack from scratch [5750 stars on Github] Courtesy of [Jonathan Verrecchia](https://medium.com/u/531775ae921b)
[read more](https://github.com/verekia/js-stack-from-scratch?utm_source=mybridge&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=read_more)
{% asset_img "2.png" "#2" %}

## Rank #3
JavaScript by Facebook. Learn how to use Yarn to increase your productivity. Courtesy of [Prosper Otemuyiwa](https://medium.com/u/9e13edbcb55f) and [Auth0](https://medium.com/u/9ef9638b3092)
[read more](https://auth0.com/blog/five-things-you-can-do-with-yarn?utm_source=mybridge&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=read_more)
{% asset_img "3.png" "#3" %}

## Rank #4
Webpack or Browserify & Gulp: Which Is Better?
[read more](https://auth0.com/blog/five-things-you-can-do-with-yarn?utm_source=mybridge&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=read_more)
{% asset_img "4.png" "#4" %}

## Rank #5 
A quick guide to JavaScript Promises. [Dominik Kundel](https://medium.com/u/fca129c29b73)
[read more](https://www.twilio.com/blog/2016/10/guide-to-javascript-promises.html?utm_source=mybridge&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=read_more)
{% asset_img "5.png" "#5" %}

## Rank #6
Practical ES6: A practical dive into ES6 and maintainable JavaScript modules [832 stars on Github]
[read more](https://github.com/mjavascript/practical-es6?utm_source=mybridge&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=read_more)
{% asset_img "6.png" "#6" %}

## Rank #7
A Study Plan To Cure JavaScript Fatigue. Courtesy of [Sacha Greif](https://medium.com/u/156e844b0e31)
[read more](https://medium.com/@sachagreif/a-study-plan-to-cure-javascript-fatigue-8ad3a54f2eb1?utm_source=mybridge&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=read_more)
{% asset_img "7.png" "#7" %}

## Rank #8
Overview of JavaScript ES6 features (a.k.a ECMAScript 6 and ES2015+). Courtesy of [Adrian Mejia](https://medium.com/u/e86755444968)
[read more](http://adrianmejia.com/blog/2016/10/19/Overview-of-JavaScript-ES6-features-a-k-a-ECMAScript-6-and-ES2015?utm_source=mybridge&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=read_more)
{% asset_img "8.png" "#8" %}

## Rank #9
What I learned from writing six functions that all did the same thing. Courtesy of [Jackson Bates](https://medium.com/u/8f91301d8667) and [Free Code Camp](https://medium.com/u/8b318225c16a)
[read more](https://medium.freecodecamp.com/what-i-learned-from-writing-six-functions-that-all-did-the-same-thing-b38fd48f0d55?utm_source=mybridge&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=read_more)
{% asset_img "9.png" "#9" %}

## Rank #10 
How to make a compiler with JavaScript. Courtesy of [Mariko Kosaka](https://medium.com/u/12579b0cb1b5)
[read more](https://medium.com/@kosamari/how-to-be-a-compiler-make-a-compiler-with-javascript-4a8a13d473b4?utm_source=mybridge&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=read_more)

Thng va ri chng ta c rt nhiu bi vit hay, mt trong nhng l do mnh kt JS chnh l v cng ng rt nng ng v hot ng cc k si ni mang n mt cuc cch mng thc s trong web developemnt. im qua cc bi vit hay ca thng ny c th nhc n 2 lung cm xc, vui c, bun c:

Tin vui l cng ng javascript c v nh ngy cng nng ng hn, tht khng iu khi ni rng Javascript l ngn ng lp trnh ph bin nht th gii, t front-end n back-end thp ch l c mobile JS ang nh bc dp ng v phn no thu hp t din ca cc ngn ng khc. Mi ngy cng ng li cho n mt vi frameworks, libs, tools hoc articles mi dev li c thm nhiu la chn hn trong pht trin v trn ht l mang n cho ngi dng tri nghim tt nht vi tng sn phm chng ta to ra.

Cn tin bun l g? ci g cng c mt tri ca n, bi vit #1 ca chng ta cng chnh l ni long ca rt nhiu anh em dev, qu nhiu frameworks, qu nhiu tools khin cho cc dev phi vt ln rt nhiu t vic la chn ri hc cch s dng v hu nh mi d n ta u phi bt u li mi th t du. Vi mnh th y cha hn l xu t nht vi js mi d n u em li cho mnh cm gic mi m khi c hc thm nhiu iu th v mi.

Im just going to move back to the backend. I just cant handle these many changes and versions and editions and compilers and transpilers. The JavaScript community is insane if it thinks anyone can keep up with this

# Khng c ai l v dng

C mt chng trai, khng thi vo i hc, cha m  tm mt ngi v ci v cho anh. Sau khi kt hn, anh dy hc ti mt trng tiu hc trong lng. V khng c kinh nghim, nn cha y mt tun anh  b hc sinh ty chay, khin anh b sa thi.

Tr v nh, ngi v kh khng lau nc mt cho anh, an i ni: Nhng vic khng va  mnh th c y ra , c ngi trt ra c, cng c ngi trt khng c, anh khng cn phi thng tm nh vy, cng s c nhiu vic thch hp hn ang ch anh kia m.

V sau, anh ra ngoi lm cng cho ngi ta, li b ng ch ui v nh v anh lm vic qu chm. Lc , v ni vi anh: ng tc lun c nhanh c chm, ngi ta  lm vic nhiu nm nh vy, cn anh th ch l hc sinh c sch, sao c th nhanh nh h c?.

Anh li tri qua rt nhiu cng vic, nhng cng vn th, phn ln l b d na chng. Th nhng, mi ln anh chn nn tht vng tr v, ngi v li lun lun an i anh, cha bao gi than trch mt cu.

Lc hn 30 tui, anh nh vo kh nng thin ph v ngn ng, lm tr ging ti trng khuyt tt. V sau, anh xy dng c mt trng khuyt tt khc. Sau , ti rt nhiu thnh ph, anh li xy dng c rt nhiu phn hiu khc. T , anh  l ng ch c ngn vn ti sn ri.

Mt ngy, cng thnh danh toi, anh hi v rng: Mi lc anh cm thy tin  v vng, iu g  khin em lc no cng c lng tin vi anh nh vy?

C tr li mc mc, n gin:
Mt mnh t, khng hp cho vic trng la mch, c th trng th u; nu u cng khng thch hp, c th th trng da leo; nu c da leo cng khng c th ri ln mt t kiu mch nht nh cng c th n hoa. Bi v mt mnh t, lun lun c mt ht ging thch hp vi n, cui cng cng s c thnh qu thu hoch trn mnh t  thi.

Trn th gian ny khng ai l v dng c, ch c iu chng ta khng t h ng v tr m thi.

(Su tm)

Post.title: tm hiu Method Chainning trong Javascript
Post.content:
Method chaining l mt trong nhng patterm quen thuc vi nhng Javascript Programer. Bi vit mnh s gi thiu Method Chainning l g, cch ci t v nhng trng hp thch hp s dng patterm ny. he, bt u thi!

Method Chainning l ci g?

Method chaining is a technique that can be used to simplify code in scenarios that involve calling multiple functions on the same object consecutively. This is an example of how you can use method chaining when using jQuery.

cng khng c g cao siu y c, Method Chainning l mt k thut trong Javascript dng gi mt lot cc hm ca mt i tng trong mt cu lnh duy nht. di y l m v d n gin v cch s dng ca Method Chainning trong Jquery.

As you can see, using method chaining can tidy up code quite a bit, however some developers dislike the visual style of method chaining and choose not to use it.

qua v d trn ta c th thy, s dng Method Chainning lm code ta ngn i kh nhiu, tuy nhin nhiu lp rnh vin khng thch phong cch chui ca Method Chainning v khng c thin cam vi n.

Bn cht ca Method Chainning

d hnh dung ta s to mt class Kitten vi ci t nh sau.

gi hy to mt thc th ca kitten v s dng n.

bn c thy c mt s lp ti y khng, bn thn mnh thch cch code n gin hn v Method Chainning chnh l gii php.

code li ri :p ! tt nhin, s dng c n ta phi ci t li class kitten .

Ci t Method Chainning

lp kitten c ci y li nh sau;

mu cht ca vn l mi phng thc u tr li tham chiu n chnh n qua c php return this;, nh vy ta c th gi mt chui cc hm ca i tng .

Post.title: quy trnh lm mt project :D
Post._content:
{% asset_img 1.jpg "project" %}

mt cu chuyn vui nhng cng rt thc t v qui trnh lm mt d n IT.
<!--more-->

 u tin l thng Sales n s gp khch hng, d d cho mi, a gi lm trong 5 thng (project c trung bnh)
}

Xong thng BA/PM s cng thng Sales ly requirements t khch hng

Song song con HR s chy i tuyn dev v  lm

Khch hng ok, k H v thanh ton 30%, sales ht trc 5% ca ci 30% , thng ny m ri

Thng team lead / project lead s cng vi thng senior dev ngi break down requirement, tnh task, xong thng team lead cng thi gian, vi requirements ny, gi t nh khng thay i thm bt g, th lm 8 thng xong

Thng PM gt g, ok deadline 4 thng, km li ha lm ngon anh share bonus d n
Thnh team lead sp xp nhn s, chia task, scrum/agile cc kiu, hng hn: d n ny anh em mnh 3 thng xong,
Thng senior dev va training cho 3 a mi v va gnh team
3 thng dev mi v tun lm 5 ngy, ngy 8 ting, cha k OT bui ti + th 7, CN lm  nh
Sau 1 thng 1 thng out, HR tuyn thm 1 thng na + PM ht 1 thng dev t team khc qua ph

Sau 1 thng na th pht hin hiu sai mt s yu cu t khch hng + khch hng mi thy 1 trang web no  c tnh nng hay qu, yu cu lm ging vy

Sau 1 thng na, v c bn d n  fail 1 cch hon ho. Thng team leader nhy v code ph 2 thng junior, do thng senior dev ang nm vin v bnh lao

PM quyt nh ko thm 2 thng dev khc t 1 d n khc vo, 2 thng ny tn tm 2 tun  ngi c documents v hiu ci mi bi nhi do 2 thng junior dev mi vo code

Qua thng th 6, thng sales hin  sang lm cho cty khc. Thng PM vn lin lc vi khch hng  k ko thi gian. V mt development team th thng senior dev  ra vin, OT c hn 1 tun ri, m cn li vn ang code + debug, thng team lead thi thong xin ngh na bui i phng vn cty no .

Qua thng th 7, khch hng  c demo  xem
Qua thng th 8, khch hng thanh ton 40% chi ph project  nhn 1 cc source code c th chy c nu click vo cc nt theo ng th t  ch dn km theo li tuyn b khng bao gi quay li
Qua thng th 9, 2 thng junior dev b ui do k nng khng t yu cu, nng sut lm vic km
Cui qu thng PM c bonus d n nh bnh thng
Thng team lead  t ra m cty ring
Thng senior dev qua Lazada lm vi mc lng gp i
HR li tip tc tuyn thm dev  lp vo ch trng

Post.title: vit mt chng trnh cho php ci plugin trong java nh th no?
Post.content:
Ch l ang tp te lm wordpress plugin, bng dng ny ra cu hi th ci t plugin trong java nh th no. Trc gi cng ch lm theo kiu yu cu n u vit n y ch cha c lm kiu plugin ny bao gi c. nh hi bc Gc vy. sau mt hi o bi cng gi l nm c i phn, note ra y cho bc no cng chung thc mc.

plugin l kh g?

Ni th ch plugin chc khng l g ri, in hnh nh cc th loi trnh duyt ph bin nh Chrome, Firefox, Opera kiu g mi ci ch ci mt ng plugin n khi trnh duyt c g bt thng li ch li u my thng plugin ra kim ra u tin. mt cch n gin th Plugin chnh l mt b phn mm ci t h tr, m rng chc nng cho mt phn mm ng dng ln hn, da trn nhng giao thc v API do phn mm ln cung cp.

plugin c g hay ho?

Kin trc plugin thc s rt tuyt vi, n cho php m rng (thp ch l thay i) cc chc nng ca cc host applications (tm gi l ng dng ch i), vi mt thit k tt cc ng dng c th cm thm bao nhiu chc nng ty thch mi plugin mang n mt tin ch dn n kh nng m rng ca h thng l cc k tuyt vi mnh xin php c nhai li mt ln na l phi thit k cho tt nh khng l ng ng li tm lum .

Vi cng ng m ngun m pht trin nh v bo ngy nay, vi mt ng dng c base tt v mt plugin API ti th tc pht trin s khng th tin ni. VD nh slack mt h thng nhn tin v trao i cng vic ang rt ni tuy cng ch mi pht trin c vi nm nhng s lng plugin trong kho ca slack rt khng l hu ht l do cc bn th ba pht trin, thc s nng gi tr ca ng dng ban u ln gp nhiu ln m mt team khng th lm ht c.

ri, th ci t thng ny th no?

i vi cc script language nh Javascript, PHP, python vi dc im mi ln chy l mt ln thng dch th c v khng gp tr ngi g ch vic dng mt thng callback hay closure l xong ci ny mnh s ni n vo mt ngy p tri khng xa. vi java cu chuyn c v khng d dng nh th, java 8 mi ra mt tnh nng Thinking cho php ci t callback & closure mt cch kh d dng cn cc ver thp hn th khng c ci g tng t c, mnh th g java nn cng thy v ny hi khoai.

V c bn c th cm c plugin th ng dng phi c kin trc n gin nht nh trong hnh trn, hai thnh phn c bn l application core v plugin manager:
- application core: thng ny l ng dng ch c nhim b bo m logic ca h thng, thc hin cc tc v v hook (gi) cc plugin thc hin nhim v ca mnh trong runtime.
- plugins manager: thng chu s ch o ca thng core c nhim v ng k cc plugin thm, g, bt, tt cc plugin.

c th cm c plugin ta phi c mt plugin interface y l giao din m tt c cc plugin s k tha, plugin manager s load cc plugins v initial (nm na l to ra thc th ca mi plugin) vo trong mt List cc plugins ri t application core s ln lt mc ra t ci mt v bt n thc hin nhim v nht nh.

H, mnh gii thch c chui qu chc ko ai hiu ni nh. trc quan sinh ng mi ae xem v d bn di.

v d trc quan n

v d ny mnh s to mt ng dng n gin vi u vo l 1 s, cc plugin s c thm vo ch bin s a ra kt qu cui cng cng tr nhn chia g .

Ok, u tin chng ta phi c mt thng interface chung cho cc plugins. tm gi l PluginFunction.java i.

Tip theo ta phi c mt ci main chy logic ca ng dng v gi cc plugin, ta gi l PluginDemo.java cha hm main.

Ta thy trong hm getPlugins c mt vng for load ht cc class m c interface l PluginFunction ri to ra mt thc th ca class v lu vo mng plugins. Sau hm runPlugins s duyt qua tt c cc plugins set tham s chy hm run ca tng plugin v in ra kt qu.

Ngoi ra hm getPlugins cn c mt iu th v na chnh l dng setSecurityManager, v y l cc plugins c lp vi h thng nn ta phhair xt qun hn cho n ch nh thanh nin no vui tnh li cho ci plugin xa ht h iu hnh th ch bit ngi y m khc thi .

y l ni dung file PluginSecurityManager.java

Ngoi ra ta cn cn 1 ci loader load cc plugins ra na PluginClassLoader.java

Haiz, v c bn h thng setup th l xong, tip theo ta s cn 1 2 ci plugins test th xem n c chy n khng, ta s t cc file ny trong th mc plugins.

Square.java tnh bnh phng ca tham s:

PlusOne.java cng 1 n v vo tham s:

TryToExit.java th cho thanh nin ny lm qun t xem c c khng, trong PluginSecurityManager ta set khng cho plugin thot chng trnh ri.

Tip theo l dch v chy th, nu khng c g sai th s thu c output nh ny, mnh dng java 8 nn c phun ra my ci Note, thi k d sao n vn chy c :

Thc ra toppic ny cn thm vn na l build ra file jar v ci t plugin bng xml nhng tp thi th ny . xin hn ae mt dp khc.

Xin chn thnh cm n b code mu ca @Ulf Dittmer, cc bn code th download code d tham kho.

Phu cm n ae theo di n tn y, bi di tay quay mi mnh xin php dng phm ti y. chc ae cui tun vui v.
xin cho thn i v qut thng.

Post.title: Helloworld
Post._content:
![first post](/image/posts/hello-world/hello.jpg)

 mun vit blog t lu m khng c c hi hay ng hn l **li** nhn c hi va nhy vic nn qut nh lm 1 blog nho nh cho mnh. 

<!--more-->

thc th th mnh vit khng c hay (hi tt ngip cp 3 c c 6 im vn :cry:) nhng c ci thch vit. i khi ang i trn ng hoc c mt t bo l ci gp c chuyn n, chuyn kia cng mun mnh c mt blog ring  by t  kin ca mnh :sunglasses:.

nhiu lc ngh ngh ca mnh cng ch khc g mt nh vn ch khc mt iu l mnh khng ngh vit vn cho con ngi c m cn cho my tnh c na :stuck_out_tongue_winking_eye: nn thc s khng d dng g.  l lp trnh vin th khng th thiu k nng vit vit lm sao  cu lnh mch lc, ngn  gn lm sao m c ngi v my u  hiu y mi l mt on code "hay". Mt trong nhng l do na  mnh qut nh tr thnh mt blogger (na ma :neutral_face:) chnh l  ci thin k nng vit.

Blog cng l mt cch  hiu r hn v bn thn, c mt danh ngn rt hay:

{% blockquote  Pat Conroy, My Reading Life  %}
Writing is the only way I have to explain my own life to myself
{% endblockquote %}

hy vng mnh s c  thi gian v nhit huyt  duy tr blog ny.
